detailed_description.textblock: The present study aims to determine the validity and reliability of the Turkish version of the "Body Perception Questionnaire (BPQ) through the Turkish translation of the questionnaire and the intercultural adaptation. The Body Perception Questionnaire (BPQ) is a self-report measure of body awareness and autonomic reactivity. Its items are based on the organization of the autonomic nervous system (ANS), a set of neural pathways connecting the brain and body. These pathways send information from the body about the status of organs and tissues (i.e., afferent projections). Some of these incoming signals form a basis for the subjective awareness of the body. The ANS also carries signals that control the functions of these organs and tissues (i.e., efferent projections). These signals can alter the functions of the body, depending on internal and external needs. The study includes 175 healthy participants and 120 participants with anxiety. Beaton's 6-step procedure was used for translation and intercultural adaptation. After the steps of the procedure were completed, the questionnaire was finalized.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Being a volunteer to participate in the study
- Being between the age of 18 - 77
- Understand and follow commands
- Not diagnosed a psychiatric disorder
Exclusion Criteria:
- Younger than the age of 18
- Reported taking psychotropic drugs and/or beta-blockers
- Did not complete the questions
- Having any surgical operation in the last six months
- Diagnosed chronic cardiovascular, pulmonary or neuromuscular systemic disorder
